info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL ROCKBRIDGE...NORTHEASTERN BEDFORD AND AMHERST COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Snowden, or near Glasgow, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Buena Vista... Amherst... Glasgow... Forks Of Buffalo... Clifford... Big Island... and Coleman Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
